description: Number of pairings {(b[1],c[1]),(b[2],c[2]),...,(b[n],c[n])} of the first 2n positive integers satisfying b[i] < c[i] and such that the 2n numbers c[i]+b[i] and c[i]-b[i] are all distinct.
comments: Huff paper has a typographical error, a(8)=2669. _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 14 2014
references: G. B. Huff, On pairings of the first 2n natural numbers, Acta Arithmetica, 23 (1973), 117-126.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
R. Spira, Noncomplete residue systems, Problem 71-4, SIAM Rev., 14 (1972), 173ff.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Better definition and values of a(11)-a(15) from _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 14 2014
